description: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,0)=T(n,n)=1 for n >= 0; for n >= 2 and 1<=k<=n-1, T(n,k)=T(n-1,k-1)+T(n-2,k-1)+T(n-1,k) if n is even and k is odd, else T(n,k)=t(n-1,k-1)+T(n-1,k).
formula: T(n, k) = number of paths from (0, 0) to (n-k, k) in the directed graph having vertices (i, j) and edges (i, j)-to-(i+1, j) and (i, j)-to-(i, j+1) for i, j >= 0 and edges (i, j)-to-(i+1, j+1) for i=0, j >= 0 if both i and j are even.Equals 2*A007318 - A034851 (i.e. twice Pascal's triangle - the Losanitch triangle). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Dec 31 2007
author: _Clark Kimberling_
